name: onion production | onion | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14664/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of onions The average yield from 2009 - 2012 is 45 t/ha. The data are representative for onion production in New Zealand, Canterbury, used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 135-40-38 kg/ha. Organic fertilisers applied amount to 6 m3/ha of liquid manure and 5 t/ha of solid manure. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 23.33 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The export share of onions produced in New Zealand amounts to 2% of the global export (tonnage exported in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing onions produced in New Zealand for the export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 1.7 (i.e. very good quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with the nursery producing seedlings, i.e. seedlings from roots.

This activity ends with the harvest of onions at farm gate. The dataset includes total diesel combusted in agricultural machinery, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered. The inputs of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0113:Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country; L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L4; Pesticides: L3; Machinery: L3; Irrigation: L3. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of onion is calculated to be circa 5.18E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'cyclic N-compound', 'dinitroaniline-compound', 'dithiocarbamate-compound', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified', 'pyrethroid-compound'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.04E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Land use change (LUC) combines land transformation areas calculated with the adapted 'Direct Land Use Change Assessment Tool' version 2014 developed by Blonk Consultants and the carbon losses from soil organic carbon (SOC) and vegetation (VEG) as calculated in ecoinvent v3. See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

exchanges.description: Calculated value - 100% emission in soil. See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'onion' is calculated to be circa 4.73E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 9.47E-03 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
